project.name: Arij
project.description: A local, AI-first project orchestrator that provides a web interface for managing multi-project workflows with Claude Code as the execution engine. It covers the full project lifecycle: ideation, specification, kanban-based planning, automated code generation via Claude Code CLI, real-time agent monitoring, and release management.
project.spec:
# Arij

A local, AI-first project orchestrator that provides a web interface for managing multi-project workflows with Claude Code as the execution engine. It covers the full project lifecycle: ideation, specification, kanban-based planning, automated code generation via Claude Code CLI, real-time agent monitoring, and release management.

## Stack
Next.js 16 (App Router, Turbopack), React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS v4, shadcn/ui, SQLite via better-sqlite3, Drizzle ORM, dnd-kit (kanban drag-and-drop), Claude Code CLI (child_process spawn), simple-git (worktrees/branches), mammoth (DOCX→MD), pdf-parse (PDF→MD), unified/remark/rehype (Markdown processing), nanoid (ID generation)

## Architecture
Full-stack Next.js 16 application with App Router. Frontend uses React 19 with shadcn/ui components and dnd-kit for the kanban board. Backend is Next.js API routes that interact with a local SQLite database via Drizzle ORM. Claude Code integration spawns the `claude` CLI as child processes (plan mode for brainstorming/spec generation, code mode for epic implementation). Git worktrees provide isolated branches per epic. File converters transform uploaded documents (PDF, DOCX) to Markdown for context injection. Real-time monitoring uses polling. All data is local-first with no cloud dependencies.

epics.title: Project Import (Existing Codebase Analysis)
epics.description: Import an existing project by pointing to a local directory. Claude Code analyzes the codebase and generates epics/user stories with confidence scores. User can preview and edit before importing.

user_stories.title: Select project folder for import
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to provide the path to an existing project folder, so that Arij can analyze it.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Path input field with folder icon
- [x] Analyze button disabled when path is empty
- [x] Loading state during analysis
- [ ] Path validation (directory exists)
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Analyze existing codebase with Claude Code
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want Claude Code to scan my codebase and identify epics, user stories, and their statuses, so that I can start from an accurate project state.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Claude Code spawned in analyze mode with restricted tools
- [x] Structured prompt requesting JSON output with project info, epics, US
- [x] Confidence scores and evidence for each status assessment
- [x] Robust JSON parsing with fallbacks
- [ ] Tests for import API and JSON parsing

user_stories.title: Preview and edit imported data before saving
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to review and adjust the detected epics and user stories before they are saved, so that the import is accurate.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Editable project name and description
- [x] Epic list with inline editing and delete
- [x] User stories displayed within epics
- [x] Status badges with color coding
- [x] Confidence percentage display
- [x] Validate & Import button creates project + epics + US in DB
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Tests & Preview Integration (V2)
epics.description: Automatic test detection/execution and dev server preview within Arij, as planned for V2.

user_stories.title: Run project tests from Arij
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to run my project's tests from within Arij, so that I can verify Claude Code's work.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Framework detection (Next.js, Vite, etc.)
- [ ] 'Run Tests' button
- [ ] Test output display
- [ ] Test report in epic view

user_stories.title: Preview project in iframe
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to preview my project's dev server in an iframe within Arij, so that I can see results without switching context.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Launch dev server
- [ ] Iframe preview display
- [ ] URL configuration

epics.title: NPM Package & CLI Distribution
epics.description: Publish Arij as an npm package with a CLI entry point so users can run it with `npx arij`.

user_stories.title: Create CLI entry point
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to run `npx arij` to start the application, so that setup is minimal.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] bin field added to package.json
- [ ] CLI entry script created
- [ ] Package name set to 'arij'
- [ ] Start command launches Next.js server

epics.title: Testing Infrastructure
epics.description: Unit tests with Vitest and E2E tests with Playwright as specified in the tech stack.

user_stories.title: Set up Vitest for unit testing
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want Vitest configured for unit testing, so that I can write and run tests for utilities, API routes, and hooks.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Vitest installed and configured
- [ ] vitest.config.ts created
- [ ] Test script added to package.json
- [ ] Sample tests for critical utilities

user_stories.title: Set up Playwright for E2E testing
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want Playwright configured for end-to-end testing, so that I can test user workflows in the browser.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Playwright installed and configured
- [ ] playwright.config.ts created
- [ ] E2E test scripts added
- [ ] Sample E2E test for core workflow

epics.title: Project CRUD & Dashboard
epics.description: Multi-project dashboard with project creation, listing, filtering, and detail views. Core project management lifecycle including archiving.

user_stories.title: Create a new project
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to create a new project with a name, optional description, and optional git repo path, so that I can start organizing my work.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Form with required name, optional description, optional git repo path
- [x] Validation prevents empty name submission
- [x] Project created in DB with nanoid ID and 'ideation' status
- [x] Redirect to project detail page on success
- [ ] Unit tests for project creation API

user_stories.title: View all projects on dashboard
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to see all my projects on a dashboard with progress indicators, so that I can track multi-project status at a glance.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Grid layout with responsive columns (1-4)
- [x] Each card shows name, description, progress bar, active agents, last activity
- [x] Filter by All / Active / Archived
- [x] Empty state with action buttons
- [ ] Unit tests for project listing API
- [ ] E2E test for dashboard rendering

user_stories.title: Edit and delete projects
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to edit project details or delete a project, so that I can keep my workspace organized.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] PATCH endpoint updates name, description, status, gitRepoPath, spec
- [x] DELETE endpoint removes project
- [x] 404 handling for missing projects
- [ ] Unit tests for update/delete API

epics.title: Database & ORM Layer
epics.description: SQLite database with Drizzle ORM schema, migrations, and connection management.

user_stories.title: Define database schema
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want a well-structured database schema covering all project entities, so that the application can persist and query data efficiently.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] 8 tables: projects, documents, epics, userStories, chatMessages, agentSessions, releases, settings
- [x] Proper field types and defaults
- [x] Cascade deletes where appropriate
- [x] Position fields for ordering
- [x] Drizzle config for migrations
- [ ] Generated migration files
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Spec Generation & Editing
epics.description: Generate project specifications with epics and user stories using Claude Code in plan mode. Edit specs in a Markdown editor with preview.

user_stories.title: Generate spec and plan from project context
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to generate a structured project spec with epics and user stories using Claude Code, so that I can quickly plan my project.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] 'Generate Spec & Plan' button in chat panel
- [x] Claude Code spawned in plan mode with structured prompt
- [x] JSON output parsed to extract spec, epics, and user stories
- [x] Epics and user stories bulk-inserted into database
- [x] Project status updated to 'specifying'
- [x] Fallback to plain text spec if JSON parsing fails
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Edit project spec in Markdown editor
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to manually edit the generated spec in a Markdown editor, so that I can refine it to my needs.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Tab interface for Edit and Preview modes
- [x] Textarea editor with monospace font
- [x] Save button with loading state
- [x] API persistence
- [ ] Rendered Markdown preview (currently raw text)
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Claude Code Build Integration
epics.description: Launch Claude Code in code mode to implement epics. Create git worktrees and branches per epic, compose structured prompts, manage build sessions.

user_stories.title: Launch Claude Code build for selected epics
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to click 'Build with Claude Code' to launch code generation for selected epics, so that Claude implements my specs.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Build button triggers API call with selected epic IDs
- [x] Parallel and sequential build mode options
- [x] Git worktree + branch created per epic
- [x] Claude Code spawned in code mode with structured prompt
- [x] Epic status moves to 'In Progress' automatically
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Compose structured build prompts
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want Claude Code to receive a prompt containing my project spec, documents, and epic details, so that it has full context for implementation.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Global prompt from settings injected
- [x] Project spec included
- [x] All project documents included as markdown
- [x] Target epic title, description, and user stories with acceptance criteria
- [x] Build instructions appended
- [ ] Tests for prompt composition

user_stories.title: Manage concurrent build sessions
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want the system to track running Claude Code processes and allow me to cancel them, so that I have control over active builds.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Singleton process manager tracks all sessions
- [x] Start, cancel, status, listActive, listAll operations
- [x] Graceful kill with SIGTERM→SIGKILL fallback (5s timeout)
- [x] Session status updates (running → completed/failed/cancelled)
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Kanban Board
epics.description: Drag-and-drop kanban board for managing epics across workflow columns (Backlog, To Do, In Progress, Review, Done) with epic detail editing.

user_stories.title: Display epics in kanban columns
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to see my epics organized in kanban columns by status, so that I can visualize my project workflow.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Five columns: Backlog, To Do, In Progress, Review, Done
- [x] Epic cards show title, priority badge, US count, branch name
- [x] Cards sorted by position within columns
- [x] Loading skeleton during data fetch
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Drag and drop epics between columns
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to drag epics between kanban columns to update their status, so that I can manage workflow progression.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Drag-and-drop between columns updates status
- [x] Drag-and-drop within column reorders position
- [x] DragOverlay provides visual feedback
- [x] Optimistic UI with rollback on API failure
- [x] Batch reorder API with transactions
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: View and edit epic details
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to click an epic card to view and edit its details including user stories, so that I can manage epic content.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Side sheet opens on epic click
- [x] Inline editing for title and description
- [x] Priority and status dropdowns
- [x] User story list with add, update status, delete
- [x] Branch name display
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Select multiple epics for batch operations
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to select multiple epics with checkboxes, so that I can launch Claude Code builds for them.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Checkbox on each epic card
- [x] Selection state tracked in parent
- [x] Build toolbar shows selected count
- [x] 'Build with Claude Code' button enabled when epics selected
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Release Management
epics.description: Create releases by selecting completed epics, generate changelogs via Claude Code, create git tags, and maintain release history.

user_stories.title: Create a release with selected epics
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to create a release by selecting completed epics and specifying a version, so that I can track what's included in each release.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Release creation dialog with version and title
- [x] Epic selection (filters to done/review status)
- [x] Release persisted with epic IDs
- [x] Release list display
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Generate changelog automatically
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to auto-generate a changelog using Claude Code based on the selected epics, so that I save time writing release notes.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Toggle to enable changelog generation
- [x] Claude Code plan mode generates changelog
- [x] Fallback auto-generated changelog if Claude fails
- [x] Changelog displayed on release card
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Create git tags for releases
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want a git tag to be created when I make a release, so that the release is tracked in version control.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Git tag created with version string
- [x] Tag name stored in DB
- [x] Tag displayed on release card
- [x] Graceful handling if git repo not configured
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Session Management & Monitoring
epics.description: Track and monitor Claude Code agent sessions with real-time status updates, detailed logs, and session lifecycle management.

user_stories.title: View session list with status indicators
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to see a list of all build sessions with their status, duration, and mode, so that I can track build history.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Session cards with status icons and color coding
- [x] Duration calculation
- [x] Mode display (plan/code)
- [x] Branch name display
- [x] Error message truncation
- [x] Running session count
- [x] Link to session detail
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: View detailed session information and logs
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to view the full details of a build session including the prompt sent, response received, and raw logs, so that I can debug issues.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Three-tab interface: Response, Prompt, Raw Logs
- [x] Status badge and metadata display
- [x] Auto-polling while session is running
- [x] Cancel button for running sessions
- [x] Export logs as JSON
- [x] Filesystem log loading
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Monitor active agents in real-time
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to see active Claude Code agents with elapsed time in a monitor bar, so that I know what's running.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Collapsible panel showing active sessions
- [x] Per-session elapsed time updating every second
- [x] Stop/Cancel button per session
- [x] Green indicator animation
- [x] Auto-hide when no active sessions
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Markdown Rendering
epics.description: Render Markdown content as styled HTML in the document viewer and spec preview components.

user_stories.title: Render Markdown in document viewer
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want uploaded documents to be displayed as rendered Markdown with proper formatting, so that I can easily read the content.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Markdown-to-HTML utility exists (lib/utils/markdown.ts)
- [x] Dependencies installed (remark, rehype, sanitize)
- [ ] DocumentViewer uses rendered HTML instead of raw text
- [ ] Prose styling applied
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Render Markdown in spec preview
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want the spec preview to show rendered Markdown, so that I can see formatted output while editing.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Markdown-to-HTML utility exists
- [ ] SpecPreview uses rendered HTML instead of raw text
- [ ] Prose styling applied
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Document Upload & Conversion
epics.description: Upload project documents (PDF, DOCX, Markdown, plain text), convert them to Markdown, and store them as project context for Claude Code sessions.

user_stories.title: Upload documents via drag-and-drop
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to drag and drop files into a project to upload them, so that I can easily add context documents.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Drag-and-drop zone with visual feedback
- [x] File input accepts .pdf, .docx, .md, .txt
- [x] Upload progress indicator
- [x] Multiple file support
- [x] API stores file with converted markdown
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Convert uploaded files to Markdown
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want uploaded PDF and DOCX files to be automatically converted to Markdown, so that they can be used as context for Claude Code.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] PDF to Markdown conversion
- [x] DOCX to Markdown conversion
- [x] Markdown and plain text passthrough
- [ ] Image OCR support (.png, .jpg)
- [ ] Tests for converter functions

user_stories.title: View uploaded documents
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to view the converted Markdown content of uploaded documents, so that I can verify the conversion quality.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Document list sidebar
- [x] Document selection with visual highlight
- [x] Document content display
- [ ] Rendered Markdown display (currently shows raw text)
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Chat Brainstorm with Claude Code
epics.description: Chat panel integrated into project views, using Claude Code in plan mode for brainstorming, ideation, and project refinement.

user_stories.title: Send and receive chat messages
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to chat with Claude Code about my project ideas, so that I can brainstorm and refine my project vision.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Message input with enter-to-send
- [x] Optimistic UI (message appears immediately)
- [x] Claude Code responds in plan mode
- [x] Message history persisted in DB
- [x] Rollback on error
- [ ] Streaming responses (currently waits for full response)
- [ ] Tests

user_stories.title: Context-aware chat with project documents
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want the chat to include my project description, uploaded documents, and existing spec as context, so that Claude Code gives relevant answers.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Project description injected
- [x] All documents injected as markdown
- [x] Existing spec injected
- [x] Recent chat history (20 messages) included
- [ ] Tests for prompt building

user_stories.title: Toggle chat panel in project view
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to show/hide the chat panel while working on my project, so that I can focus on the kanban or chat as needed.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Toggle button in project header
- [x] Chat panel appears on right side
- [x] Panel collapses when toggled off
- [ ] Tests

epics.title: Global Settings
epics.description: Application-wide settings including a global prompt injected into all Claude Code sessions.

user_stories.title: Configure global prompt for Claude Code
user_stories.description: As a developer, I want to set a global prompt that is injected into all Claude Code sessions, so that I can customize AI behavior across all projects.
user_stories.acceptance_criteria:
- [x] Settings page with global prompt textarea
- [x] Save button with loading state
- [x] Persisted in DB settings table
- [x] Injected into all Claude Code prompts
- [ ] Tests
